Release Notes

September 30th, 2021

21.09 Updates

We are pleased to announce the first release Intel® Smart Edge Open.

Built from an OpenNESS foundation and representing more than two years of development, the 21.09 release of Intel® Smart Edge Open introduces several technical improvements including a new Developer Experience Kit and an upgraded experience kit for creating 5G private wireless networks.

Added

Introduced the Developer Experience Kit

IntelÂ® Smart Edge Open is shifting to Ubuntu 20.04 LTS as the default OS in order to simplify future OS support. The Developer Experience kit uses Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Other experience kits will be updated from CentOS to Ubuntu in future releases

  • Automated deployment process for experience kits, based on the IntelÂ® Edge Software Provisioner (IntelÂ® ESP). (Currently available in the Developer Experience Kit.)
  • Developer Experience Release Notes

5G Private Wireless Experience Kit with Integrated RAN that combines a 5G core, 5G RAN and IntelÂ® Smart Edge Open platform in a single, validated solution, using commercial grade CNFs.

  • Support for 3rd Generation IntelÂ® XeonÂ® Scalable Processors (code name Ice Lake)
  • Support for IntelÂ® vRAN Dedicated Accelerator ACC100
  • Support for IntelÂ® QuickAssist Adapter 8970
  • Support for IntelÂ® Ethernet Converged Network Adapter X710-DA4
  • CNF support
    • DU: L1 verified FlexRAN BBU v20.11
    • DU: L2 verified Radisys L2 DU v2.2
    • CU: L2/L3 verified Radisys L2/L3 CU v2.2
    • UPF, AMF and SMF: verified Radisys 5G Core v2.2
  • Support for Foxconn Sub6 4x4 RRH
    • RPQN-7800, 3.3-3.6GHz with firmware version: v1.0.3q 432
Changed
  • 5G On Premises Edge has been re-named to 5G Private Wireless Experience Kit with Integrated RAN
  • Calico CNI is the default CNI for IntelÂ® Smart Edge Open.
  • All documentation for IntelÂ® Smart Edge Open is now publicly available
Fixed
  • Fixed stability and reliability with 5G Private Wireless Experience Kit with Integrated RAN.
Known Issues
  • Radisys CU support for multiple SR-IOV virtual functions has not been validated.
